Actually only the LPL is running their first seed off of circuit points. The LCK and LCS both award no points to the first place finisher of the Summer Playoffs and instead that team auto-qualifies as the first seed to worlds. Circuit points are adjusted such that each position in summer is the same as the one above in spring (ie. #2 Summer = 90pts = #1 Spring). The team with the most combined circuit points is the second seed and the third seed is the winner of the gauntlet (which is seeded based on total circuit points). LPL runs their gauntlet differently as a double elimination bracket and the top two teams qualify as second and third seed.

> We also weren’t completely satisfied with the way teams were seeded into the Knockout Stage from the Group Stage, with teams potentially being incentivized to not win a group in order to draw a perceived better matchup in the knockout round. As such, we’ll be introducing randomization elements on which 1st place group finishers face-off against 2nd place group finishers in the Quarterfinals.

I agree that it was a problem, but this is possibly the worst "solution" you can think of. Last year a team gave up 1st place, so as 2nd they can get the team they prefer to play against. This year, BOTH team (1st and 2nd) will lean back, because they'll have a 50% chance anyway to play against one of the teams from the other group. So there's no point wasting energy.

tl;dr last year a team underperformed because of a tactic, this year EVERY group's 1st and 2nd team will underperform because why waste resources, there's no point in winning the group. This is a terrible idea.

What? This is a great solution to it. This teams want to get first in their groups in order to play the teams that placed and are, theoretically, either worse or under performing teams. Their is absolutely no reason to not try to get first place in a group now. Also I have no idea where you got the 50% from or what you're even talking about????

There are 4 teams in one group. Every group's 1st and 2nd place will go to the Knockout stage. Let's stick to Group A's view. Group A's 1st place will play with Group B, C or D's 2nd place and Group A's 2nd place will play with Group B, C or D's 1st place. As a Group A 1st, let's say, you won't know which group your opponent will be from. It pretty much doesn't matter if you finish 1st or 2nd in your group, because 1) you'll get to the Knockout stage anyway, 2) you'll get a randomized opponent. The chance isn't 50%, it's 33%, I went full retard there, sorry. But still, it's totally randomized. There's no need to go with full throttle for the 1st place, because there's no guarantee that being 1st will result in a "more optimal" opponent. Also, the first group's teams finishing their matches first will have no idea who's 1st and 2nd in other groups, because there are still game(s) left there. They can't say "Hey, let's win this group, this way we'll have to play against Group C's 2nd, which is easier." No guarantee that they won't get SKT or EDG as opponent.

Maybe I'm not seeing the point of this system, maybe I'm just unable to describe my problem properly (damn you, language barrier), but I don't think this is a good solution.
It's not random who is coming out of the groups. The best teams like SKT are most likely going to win their group, therefore you want to win so you don't have to play them in the first round.

No, if you're a team you'd much rather get first in the group because the chances are that you'll play teams such as origen or yoe rather than if you got second you'd have to play SKT in the first round.  If you go for first place, you will probably have a much easier time making it to the semifinals.
